page.title: 04HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: CHIEFLOWMAN HOUSE THIS OLD HOUSE IS BUILT OF STONE FROM THE WESTLEIGH QUARRIES.MOSTLY AROUND THE HOUSE YOU CAN SEE THE REMAINS OF THE OLD SAXON MANOR.BEHIND THE HOUSE IS AN ASH HOUSE.WOOD AND ASH FROM THE HOUSE FIRES WOULD BE STORED THEN PUT ON THE GARDEN WHICH WOULD ACT AS A FERTILIZER.IN THIS HOUSE THE LORD OF THE MANOR LIVED.OUTSIDE THE HOUSE THERE IS A MOUNTING BLOCK COVERED BY MOSS.THE FIELDS ARE STRAIGHT AND FLAT AND IT IS SAID THAT THERE USED TO BE A VILLAGE LAKE IN THESE FLAT FIELDS. STAGMILL IN THE SECOND WORLD WAR THE MILL WAS DISMANTLED IT WAS USED UNTIL 1939.AT THE PRESENT STUDY THERE IS AN OLD OAK CEILING WHICH IS THE FINEST IN EAST DEVON.
